message: playwright: Up and running with a persistent connection!
filesystem: Up and running with a persistent connection!
excel: Up and running with a persistent connection!

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

tools.description: Copy existing sheet to a new sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

srcSheetName.description: Source sheet name in the Excel file

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

range.description: Range of cells to read in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10"). [default: first paging range]

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

tools.description: [Windows only] Take a screenshot of the Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

knownPagingRanges.description: List of already read paging ranges

tools.description: Write values to the Excel sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

newSheet.description: Create a new sheet if true, otherwise write to the existing sheet

values.description: Values to write to the Excel sheet. If the value is a formula, it should start with "="

includeComments.description: Whether to include descriptive comments in generated tests

tools.name: playwright_assert_response
tools.description: Wait for and validate a previously initiated HTTP response wait operation.

id.description: Identifier of the HTTP response initially expected using `Playwright_expect_response`.

value.description: Data to expect in the body of the HTTP response. If provided, the assertion will fail if this value is not found in the response body.

{'model': 'o4-mini-2025-04-16', 'messages': [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are an efficient and precise automated assistant specialized in web automation, file operations, and Excel manipulation. Follow instructions exactly and provide detailed, structured responses.

                    Web Automation Protocol:
                    1. Precise Navigation:
                        - Execute exact browser actions (click, type, scroll) with explicit selectors
                        - Validate successful navigation and actions
                        - Handle dynamic content and loading states
                        - Default to www.lastmileai.dev unless specified otherwise
                    
                    2. Data Extraction & Processing:
                        - Extract data using optimized selectors
                        - Capture targeted screenshots of relevant elements
                        - Generate structured summaries with clear hierarchies
                        - Process and validate extracted information
                    
                    File System Operations:
                    1. Core Functions:
                        - Read/write operations with proper error handling
                        - Directory manipulation with validation
                        - File search with multiple criteria
                        - Change monitoring with event tracking
                    
                    2. Best Practices:
                        - Always use absolute paths
                        - Implement error handling and recovery
                        - Verify operations before confirming
                        - Maintain data integrity checks
                    
                    Excel Processing:
                    1. Data Operations:
                        - Structured read/write operations
                        - Formula validation and optimization
                        - Multi-sheet coordination
                        - Data validation implementation
                    
                    2. Workbook Management:
                        - Efficient worksheet organization
                        - Template-based creation
                        - Cross-reference handling
                        - Format standardization
                    
                    Response Protocol:
                    1. Always confirm understanding of the task
                    2. Break complex operations into clear steps
                    3. Provide progress updates for long operations
                    4. Report success/failure with specific details
                    5. Suggest optimizations when applicable
                    
                    Error Handling:
                    1. Implement proper try-catch blocks
                    2. Provide detailed error messages

                    Remember: Validate all inputs, use absolute paths, handle errors gracefully, and maintain data integrity.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Please use the Playwright MCP tool to perform the following task in a real browser session (fill all the information, click the buttons, and so on):

Fill in the username field with standard_user
Fill in the password field with secret_sauce
Click the Login Button

Take the screenshot and save it as logged-in.png

Then, generate the corresponding Playwright Test Script in Javascript that matches these steps with the following specifications:
TEST REQUIREMENTS:

Create a test file named "saucedemo.test.js" (must include .test.js extension)
Include multi-browser support for Chrome and Firefox
Add proper wait strategies and error handling
Include screenshot functionality for each browser (logged-in-chromium.png, logged-in-firefox.png)
Add console logging to show progress for each browser
Set up for both sequential and parallel execution options

CONFIGURATION REQUIREMENTS:

Create a clean playwright.config.js file (JavaScript, NOT TypeScript)
Set testDir to current directory '.'
Configure projects for 'chromium' and 'firefox' only
Enable headed mode (headless: false) for visible browser execution
Add slowMo for better visibility during execution
Set fullyParallel: true for parallel execution capability
Include proper reporter configuration for HTML reports

BATCH FILE REQUIREMENTS:
Create multiple execution options:

"run-parallel.bat" - Runs both browsers simultaneously with playwright dependencies installed
"run-sequential.bat" - Runs browsers one after another with playwright dependencies installed
"diagnostic.bat" - Verifies setup and lists available tests with playwright dependencies installed

CLEANUP REQUIREMENTS:

Clean node_modules and package-lock.json before fresh installation
Ensure no conflicting TypeScript configurations exist

Using File system MCP tool save everything in C:\Users\Ayush Singh\Desktop\Mcp Claude\Mcp_prompt

Execute with visible browser windows
Generate screenshots for each browser

{'model': 'o4-mini-2025-04-16', 'messages': [{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are an efficient and precise automated assistant specialized in web automation, file operations, and Excel manipulation. Follow instructions exactly and provide detailed, structured responses.

1) cleanup.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Cleaning up workspace...
if exist node_modules rmdir /s /q node_modules
if exist package-lock.json del /f /q package-lock.json
if exist tsconfig.json del /f /q tsconfig.json
for %%f in (tsconfig.*.json) do if exist "%%f" del /f /q "%%f"
echo Cleanup complete.
```

2) diagnostic.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Listing available tests...
npx playwright test --list
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Diagnostic encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Diagnostic completed successfully.
```

3) run-parallel.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running tests in parallel (Chromium & Firefox)...
npx playwright test --workers=2 --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Test run encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

4) run-sequential.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running Chromium tests...
npx playwright test --project=chromium --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Chromium tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Running Firefox tests...
npx playwright test --project=firefox --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Firefox tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

```json
{
  "name": "saucedemo-playwright",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "test": "playwright test",
    "test:parallel": "playwright test --workers=2",
    "test:sequential:chromium": "playwright test --project=chromium",
    "test:sequential:firefox": "playwright test --project=firefox",
    "diagnostic": "playwright test --list",
    "cleanup": "cleanup.bat"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@playwright/test": "^1.36.0"
  }
}
```

6) playwright.config.js  
```js
const { defineConfig } = require('@playwright/test');

/**
 * @type {import('@playwright/test').PlaywrightTestConfig}
 */
module.exports = defineConfig({
  testDir: '.',
  fullyParallel: true,
  timeout: 60000,
  reporter: [
    ['list'],
    ['html', { open: 'never' }]
  ],
  use: {
    headless: false,
    viewport: { width: 1280, height: 720 },
    actionTimeout: 0,
    ignoreHTTPSErrors: true
  },
  projects: [
    {
      name: 'chromium',
      use: { browserName: 'chromium', slowMo: 500 }
    },
    {
      name: 'firefox',
      use: { browserName: 'firefox', slowMo: 500 }
    }
  ]
});
```

7) saucedemo.test.js  
```js
const { test, expect } = require('@playwright/test');

test.describe.parallel('SauceDemo Login', () => {

  test('standard user can login and see inventory', async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Starting login test`);
    try {
      await page.goto('https://www.saucedemo.com', { waitUntil: 'load' });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Navigated to saucedemo.com`);

      await page.fill('#user-name', 'standard_user');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled username`);

      await page.fill('#password', 'secret_sauce');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled password`);

      await page.click('#login-button');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Clicked login button`);

      await page.waitForURL('**/inventory', { timeout: 10000 });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Inventory page loaded`);

      const screenshotPath = `logged-in-${testInfo.project.name}.png`;
      await page.screenshot({ path: screenshotPath, fullPage: true });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Screenshot saved: ${screenshotPath}`);

    } catch (error) {
      console.error(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Test failed:`, error);
      throw error;
    }
  });

});
```

1) cleanup.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Cleaning up workspace...
if exist node_modules rmdir /s /q node_modules
if exist package-lock.json del /f /q package-lock.json
if exist tsconfig.json del /f /q tsconfig.json
for %%f in (tsconfig.*.json) do if exist "%%f" del /f /q "%%f"
echo Cleanup complete.
```

2) diagnostic.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Listing available tests...
npx playwright test --list
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Diagnostic encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Diagnostic completed successfully.
```

3) run-parallel.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running tests in parallel (Chromium & Firefox)...
npx playwright test --workers=2 --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Test run encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

4) run-sequential.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running Chromium tests...
npx playwright test --project=chromium --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Chromium tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Running Firefox tests...
npx playwright test --project=firefox --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Firefox tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

```js
const { defineConfig } = require('@playwright/test');

/**
 * @type {import('@playwright/test').PlaywrightTestConfig}
 */
module.exports = defineConfig({
  testDir: '.',
  fullyParallel: true,
  timeout: 60000,
  reporter: [
    ['list'],
    ['html', { open: 'never' }]
  ],
  use: {
    headless: false,
    viewport: { width: 1280, height: 720 },
    actionTimeout: 0,
    ignoreHTTPSErrors: true
  },
  projects: [

      name: 'chromium',
      use: { browserName: 'chromium', slowMo: 500 }
    },
    {
      name: 'firefox',
      use: { browserName: 'firefox', slowMo: 500 }
    }
  ]
});
```

```js
const { test, expect } = require('@playwright/test');

test.describe.parallel('SauceDemo Login', () => {

  test('standard user can login and see inventory', async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Starting login test`);
    try {
      await page.goto('https://www.saucedemo.com', { waitUntil: 'load' });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Navigated to saucedemo.com`);

      await page.fill('#user-name', 'standard_user');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled username`);

      await page.fill('#password', 'secret_sauce');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled password`);

      await page.click('#login-button');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Clicked login button`);

      await page.waitForURL('**/inventory', { timeout: 10000 });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Inventory page loaded`);

      const screenshotPath = `logged-in-${testInfo.project.name}.png`;
      await page.screenshot({ path: screenshotPath, fullPage: true });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Screenshot saved: ${screenshotPath}`);

    } catch (error) {
      console.error(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Test failed:`, error);
      throw error;
    }
  });

});
```

```
if exist node_modules rmdir /s /q node_modules
if exist package-lock.json del /f /q package-lock.json
if exist tsconfig.json del /f /q tsconfig.json
for %%f in (tsconfig.*.json) do if exist "%%f" del /f /q "%%f"
echo Cleanup complete.
```

2) diagnostic.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Listing available tests...
npx playwright test --list
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Diagnostic encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Diagnostic completed successfully.
```

3) run-parallel.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running tests in parallel (Chromium & Firefox)...
npx playwright test --workers=2 --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Test run encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

4) run-sequential.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running Chromium tests...
npx playwright test --project=chromium --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Chromium tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Running Firefox tests...
npx playwright test --project=firefox --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Firefox tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

5) package.json  
```json
{
  "name": "saucedemo-playwright",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "test": "playwright test",
    "test:parallel": "playwright test --workers=2",
    "test:sequential:chromium": "playwright test --project=chromium",
    "test:sequential:firefox": "playwright test --project=firefox",
    "diagnostic": "playwright test --list",
    "cleanup": "cleanup.bat"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@playwright/test": "^1.36.0"
  }
}
```

6) playwright.config.js  
```js
const { defineConfig } = require('@playwright/test');

/**
 * @type {import('@playwright/test').PlaywrightTestConfig}
 */
module.exports = defineConfig({
  testDir: '.',
  fullyParallel: true,
  timeout: 60000,
  reporter: [
    ['list'],
    ['html', { open: 'never' }]
  ],
  use: {
    headless: false,
    viewport: { width: 1280, height: 720 },
    actionTimeout: 0,
    ignoreHTTPSErrors: true
  },
  projects: [
    {
      name: 'chromium',
      use: { browserName: 'chromium', slowMo: 500 }
    },
    {
      name: 'firefox',
      use: { browserName: 'firefox', slowMo: 500 }
    }
  ]
});
```

7) saucedemo.test.js  
```js
const { test, expect } = require('@playwright/test');

test.describe.parallel('SauceDemo Login', () => {

  test('standard user can login and see inventory', async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Starting login test`);
    try {
      await page.goto('https://www.saucedemo.com', { waitUntil: 'load' });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Navigated to saucedemo.com`);

      await page.fill('#user-name', 'standard_user');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled username`);

      await page.fill('#password', 'secret_sauce');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled password`);

      await page.click('#login-button');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Clicked login button`);

      await page.waitForURL('**/inventory', { timeout: 10000 });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Inventory page loaded`);

      const screenshotPath = `logged-in-${testInfo.project.name}.png`;
      await page.screenshot({ path: screenshotPath, fullPage: true });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Screenshot saved: ${screenshotPath}`);

    } catch (error) {
      console.error(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Test failed:`, error);
      throw error;
    }
  });

});
```

1) cleanup.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Cleaning up workspace...
if exist node_modules rmdir /s /q node_modules
if exist package-lock.json del /f /q package-lock.json
if exist tsconfig.json del /f /q tsconfig.json
for %%f in (tsconfig.*.json) do if exist "%%f" del /f /q "%%f"
echo Cleanup complete.
```

2) diagnostic.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Listing available tests...
npx playwright test --list
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Diagnostic encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Diagnostic completed successfully.
```

3) run-parallel.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running tests in parallel (Chromium & Firefox)...
npx playwright test --workers=2 --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Test run encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
echo Open the HTML report at playwright-report\index.html
```

4) run-sequential.bat  
```
@echo off
echo Installing dependencies...
npm install
echo Running Chromium tests...
npx playwright test --project=chromium --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Chromium tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Running Firefox tests...
npx playwright test --project=firefox --reporter=html
if %errorlevel% neq 0 (
  echo Firefox tests encountered errors.
  exit /b %errorlevel%
)
echo Tests completed successfully.
```

```js
const { defineConfig } = require('@playwright/test');

/**
 * @type {import('@playwright/test').PlaywrightTestConfig}
 */
module.exports = defineConfig({
  testDir: '.',
  fullyParallel: true,
  timeout: 60000,
  reporter: [
    ['list'],
    ['html', { open: 'never' }]
  ],
  use: {
    headless: false,
    viewport: { width: 1280, height: 720 },
    actionTimeout: 0,
    ignoreHTTPSErrors: true
  },
  projects: [
    {
      name: 'chromium',
      use: { browserName: 'chromium', slowMo: 500 }
    },
    {
      name: 'firefox',
      use: { browserName: 'firefox', slowMo: 500 }
    }
  ]
});
```

7) saucedemo.test.js  
```js
const { test, expect } = require('@playwright/test');

test.describe.parallel('SauceDemo Login', () => {

  test('standard user can login and see inventory', async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Starting login test`);
    try {
      await page.goto('https://www.saucedemo.com', { waitUntil: 'load' });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Navigated to saucedemo.com`);

      await page.fill('#user-name', 'standard_user');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled username`);

      await page.fill('#password', 'secret_sauce');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Filled password`);

      await page.click('#login-button');
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Clicked login button`);

      await page.waitForURL('**/inventory', { timeout: 10000 });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Inventory page loaded`);

      const screenshotPath = `logged-in-${testInfo.project.name}.png`;
      await page.screenshot({ path: screenshotPath, fullPage: true });
      console.log(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Screenshot saved: ${screenshotPath}`);

    } catch (error) {
      console.error(`[${testInfo.project.name}] Test failed:`, error);
      throw error;
    }
  });

});
```
